registerText: Please fill in in the information below
noMembershiptext1: We couldn't find an active membership linked to your email.
noMembershiptext2: If you wish to activate a membership, it's easy to do right here in the app. Just choose the membership you're interested in and complete the payment, you'll get instant access to the space.
noMembertext1: We are missing some information about your membership.
noMembertext2: Please press the button below to see what is missing.
memberBasetext: With our Basic Membership, you're welcome to use our makerspace during our open evenings and Saturday workshops.
memberIndivdualText: With a Lab Membership, you get 24/7 access to the Makerspace. You'll also get a personal storage box, so you don't have to carry your things back and forth.
labMemberFamilyText: With a Family Lab Membership, up to four people registered at the same address get 24/7 access to the Makerspace.
memberDiscountedText: If you are a student, pensioner or unemployed you can get access to the Makerspace during our open evenings and Saturday workshops at a reduced price.
memberDiscountedLabText: If you are a student, pensioner or unemployed you can get 24/7 access to the Makerspace at a reduced price.
memberFamilyText: With a family membership, up to four people registered at the same address get access to the Makerspace during our open evenings and Saturday workshops.
memberQuarterlyLabText: With a quarterly lab membership, you get 24/7 access to the Makerspace for three months. This requires membership.
IAgree: I have read and promise to follow the membership agreement.
AgreementInfo: All of our members must read and promise to follow our Membership Agreement.
CloseToAgree: You have now read the entire Agreement
AlertEndDate: Psst - your lab membership needs to be renewed within
LoggedInAsMember: You are logged in as a member.
Name: Name
WriteSlack: You can also write to us on Slack:
PressSlack: Click here to go to our Slack channel.
SwishOnThisDevice: Pay with Swish on this device
SwishOnOtherDevice: Pay with Swish on another device
FamilyMember: You are part of a family membership
FillInEmail: Fill in your email in order to reset your password
SomethingWentWrong: Something went wrong, please try again.
MembershipRegistered: Your membership is now registered. If you purchased a lab membership, your keys will be activated immediately, and you will have access to our facilities. Have fun and take good care of our ficilities!
Membershipstext1: At Uppsala Makerspace, we believe creativity should be accessible to everyone, regardless of financial circumstances. That is why we aim to keep membership fees as low as possible. In return, we all need to contribute to the work required to keep our community thriving
MembershipsText:
Liability Agreement version: 210912

Lab members at Uppsala Makerspace can get their own access and be in the space to work on their projects when it suits them. To facilitate collaboration and ensure a fun and safe environment, we have established the following simple rules. Members who abuse this trust may be suspended for a longer or shorter period.

Access to the premises:
• Visitors are welcome, especially during open evenings, but regular access to the space requires lab membership in the association.
• If I let in someone who is not a lab member, I am personally responsible for everything they do. Membership can be verified at uppsalamakerspace.se/medlem/.
• The last person to leave the space ensures that all machines are turned off, windows are closed, lights are off, and the inner door is shut and locked.

Order and tidiness:
• After a work session, trash should be cleaned up and tools returned. As a rule, the space should be left in the same or better condition than when you arrived.
• Personal belongings and parts of ongoing projects are stored in a personal bin on the designated shelf. Larger items may be stored temporarily in the storage room in designated areas if labeled and space allows. Label with name, phone number, and estimated project completion date.
• Food may only be consumed in the kitchen and lounge but must not be left out. Drugs and alcoholic beverages are not allowed in the space. Clean up after yourself—pour out old coffee, discard apple cores, and remove anything that might mold.

Safety:
• In the wood and metal workshops, long hair must be tied back, loose clothing avoided, and protective equipment used.
• For your own and others' safety, and to prevent damage, only use tools you are confident in handling. If unsure, ask others for advice or refrain from use.
• Some tools may have specific usage requirements posted nearby—these must be followed.
• It's important to be familiar with where the first aid kit and fire extinguishers are located.

Community:
• Conversations are held in a respectful tone, and it goes without saying that we help each other and share our experiences.
• We respect when someone needs to concentrate and avoid unnecessary interruptions.
